sentences: Manny Albam (June 24, 1922 â€“ October 2, 2001) was an American jazz saxophonist, composer, arranger, record producer, and educator.
He was attracted to jazz at an early age when heard the music of Bix Beiderbecke.
By 1950 Albam was concentrating less on performing and more on writing and arranging.
Albam wrote arrangements for Leonard Bernstein's score for the musical West Side Story in 1957.
The work earned him a Grammy Award nomination in 1959.
In the early 1960s he became music director for Solid State Records.
